pullRequest.body:
Let `C` a category equipped with a Grothendieck topology `J`. Let `A` be a concrete category. In this file, we introduce a type-class `J.WEqualsLocallyBijective A` which says that the class `J.W` (of morphisms of presheaves which become isomorphisms after sheafification) is the class of morphisms that are both locally injective and locally surjective (i.e. locally bijective). We prove that this holds iff for any presheaf `P : Cáµ’áµ– â¥¤ A`, the sheafification map `toSheafify J P` is locally bijective. We show that this holds under certain universe assumptions.

---

- [x] depends on: #13318

How often will this be used? Is it worth adding a new abbrev `Presheaf.IsLocallyBijective J f := Presheaf.IsLocallyInjective J f âˆ§ Presheaf.IsLocallySurjective J f `?

> How often will this be used? Is it worth adding a new abbrev `Presheaf.IsLocallyBijective J f := Presheaf.IsLocallyInjective J f âˆ§ Presheaf.IsLocallySurjective J f `?

We could do it, but as `IsLocallyInjective/Surjective` are type-classes, I would rather not introduce this abbreviation. Lemmas typically use the local injectivitity or the local surjectivity, but not that many use both assumptions.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

LGTM! I need #13396 (which depends on this) for applications in condensed mathematics.
LGTM! I need #13396 (which depends on this) for applications in condensed mathematics.
Doesn't this follow from `IsLocallyInjective f â†” mono f` and `IsLocallyInjective f â†” epi f` and that `Sheaf J (Type w)` is balanced?
This lemma does not use `HasSheafify J (Type w)`, but `IsLocallySurjective f â†” epi f` does, so that I would prefer keeping the statement of this lemma as is.

nodes.body: How often will this be used? Is it worth adding a new abbrev `Presheaf.IsLocallyBijective J f := Presheaf.IsLocallyInjective J f âˆ§ Presheaf.IsLocallySurjective J f `?
LGTM! I need #13396 (which depends on this) for applications in condensed mathematics.

> How often will this be used? Is it worth adding a new abbrev `Presheaf.IsLocallyBijective J f := Presheaf.IsLocallyInjective J f âˆ§ Presheaf.IsLocallySurjective J f `?

We could do it, but as `IsLocallyInjective/Surjective` are type-classes, I would rather not introduce this abbreviation. Lemmas typically use the local injectivitity or the local surjectivity, but not that many use both assumptions.

Pull request successfully merged into master.
